source.5b74963d:
df = df.dropna(subset=['Age'])
def Age(age):
    if age >= 90 : return '90 years old'
    if age >= 80 : return '80 years old'
    if age >= 70 : return '70 years old'
    if age >= 60 : return '60 years old'
    if age >= 50 : return '50 years old'
    if age >= 40 : return '40 years old'
    if age >= 30 : return '30 years old'
    if age >= 20 : return '20 years old'
    else: return 'Teenager'
df['age_group'] = df.apply(lambda x: Age(x["Age"]), axis = 1)
source.eefcf14c:
youngest_billionair_age = df['Age'].min() # the youngest billionair is 18 years old
youngest_billionair = df[df['Age'] == 18.0]
youngest_billionair
source.47efdf90:
oldest_billionair_age = df['Age'].max() # the oldest billionair is 99 years old
oldest_billionair = df[df['Age'] == 99.0]
oldest_billionair
source.e108c361:
fig = px.histogram(df, x="age_group",
                   title='What age group is the most on the Forbes list?',
                   labels={'age_group':'Age group'})
fig.update_xaxes(categoryorder = 'total descending')
fig.show()
source.6c0951f9:
ds = data.copy()
ds =data.copy()
ds['geometry'] = ds['geometry'].apply(wkt.loads)
world = gpd.read_file(gpd.datasets.get_path('naturalearth_lowres'))
ds = gpd.GeoDataFrame(ds).set_geometry('geometry')
base = world.plot(color='white', edgecolor='black', figsize=(16, 9))
ds.plot(ax=base, marker='o', color='red', markersize=1)
source.b0ac54e8:
plt.figure(figsize=(13,5))
mar_stat_count = df['Status'].value_counts()
ax = sns.countplot(x="Status", 
                   data = df,
                   order = mar_stat_count.index,
                   linewidth=2)
for rect in ax.patches:
    ax.text (rect.get_x() + rect.get_width()  / 2,rect.get_height()+ 0.75,rect.get_height(),horizontalalignment='center', fontsize = 13)
ax.set_title('What is the most common marital situation among billionaires?',fontsize = 15, fontweight='bold' )
ax.set_xlabel('Marital status', fontsize = 15)
ax.set_ylabel('N° of people', fontsize = 15)
source.c5ea522e:
plt.figure(figsize=(20,5))
mar_stat_count = df['Children'].value_counts()
ax = sns.countplot(x="Children", 
                   data = df,
                   order = mar_stat_count.index,
                   linewidth=2)
for rect in ax.patches:
    ax.text (rect.get_x() + rect.get_width()  / 2,rect.get_height()+ 0.75,rect.get_height(),horizontalalignment='center', fontsize = 13)
ax.set_title('How many children do billionaires have?',fontsize = 30, fontweight='bold' )
ax.set_xlabel('N° of children', fontsize = 15)
ax.set_ylabel('N° of people', fontsize = 15)

source.83eef316:
plt.figure(figsize=(8,6))
mar_stat_count = df['Self_made'].value_counts()
ax = sns.countplot(x="Self_made", 
                   data = df,
                   order = mar_stat_count.index,
                   linewidth=2)
for rect in ax.patches:
    ax.text (rect.get_x() + rect.get_width()  / 2,rect.get_height()+ 0.75,rect.get_height(),horizontalalignment='center', fontsize = 13)
ax.set_title('There are more self-made man or not?',fontsize = 15, fontweight='bold' )
ax.set_ylabel('N° of people', fontsize = 10)

source.c4aaf16f: # **There are more self-made man or not?**
source.bc6fad91: **The Forbes World’s Billionaires list is a snapshot of wealth using stock prices and exchange rates from March 18, 2020. Some people become richer or poorer within days of publication. In this notebook we will try to analyze this list in its various facets**
source.cd963be9: I think that between one decade and another there may be different differences between the various mentalities and behaviors of people so I decided to divide the billionaires into age groups, which one do you think could be the most present on the list? And then, do you know who is the youngest and oldest billionair?
source.0c466ace: Who are the richest people in the world for the 2021 Forbes List? Let's try to find out
source.020a1770: Before we took a look at which were the 10 countries with the most millionaires, but now with the help of a map we can see more widely the geographical arrangement of the countries of origin of the billionaires on the list
source.288f1ac1: It certainly seems strange to hear that a man can have 23 children, in fact, **Mr. Roman Avdeev adopted 19**. He adopted the first two children in 2002 when he realized that his help with orphanages was ineffective.
source.ec4ab9cb: As we can see, most of them have **2,3 or 4 children**, like all 'normal' families. However, there are also records of children such as the one who has 23, let's find out who he is
source.40492044: As we can see, love triumphs even among billionaires as there is **a large majority of married** billionaires, unfortunately followed by many divorced.
source.843297d2: The oldest billionair is **George Joseph** (born September 11, **1921**), that is the founder of Mercury Insurance Group of Los Angeles.
source.0186b36e: As we can see, **the age groups between 50 and 80 are the most present among the billionaires**. I might think it is for an experience factor as as you grow up, you can make mistakes and try to improve yourself by reaching that age with a lot of experience and money if you have made the right choices
source.cf0852c1: Do you think billionaires prefer to have children or just dedicate themselves to their career? And if they had children, how many do you think a billionaire has on average?
source.20f4a59b: As we could have expected the nations with the most billionaires are the **United States** and **China**, followed by **India** (which i think will increase this number very quickly in the next few years), **Germany** and **Russia**.

source.00ed5551: **Replace the True or False value with 'Self-made' or 'No Self-made' for a better comprehension**
source.bbeacad0: In today's world, is it still possible to emerge as a self-made man or do you have to make your way inside or with a company to become rich and not get sucked into the market? Let's find out
source.c3c5e6d3: To my surprise, we can see that **there are more self-made man billionaires than not self-made**. So this means that you too, you who are reading this notebook, if you put your best effort into it, you could become one of them.
source.01c7e744: As we can see there is a **fairly varied distribution** on the map, unfortunately, however, **in Africa and the Middle East there is a lot of lack**. We hope that in the next few years the situation will change and there may be billionaires in those areas as well
source.985d1619: The youngest billionair is **Kevin David Lehmann**, billionaire **since he was 14**. He is now eighteen, he has inherited from his father the "dm" grocery chain, the largest in Europe.
